title: Am I really bisexual? I’ve only ever liked girls but find the male body kind of attractive. - Quora

response.answer_text: You could be bisexual. You could also not be bisexual. Finding something attractive and being sexually/emotionally attracted to something is not the same thing. If you want to, explore that part of your identity but also don’t pressure yourself or worry too much about a label, when you’re certain of your feelings you can worry about those things. I am not saying anyone might be too young to know their sexual identity, but many teenagers experience bi-curious feelings as their bodies change and adapt. You might be seeing your assigned-male friends and be attracted to parts of their bodies that you envy? Regardless - explore, be safe & don’t worry too much about a label.

There are different types of attraction. You could be bisexual or not. If you only feel aesthetic attraction towards males, you maybe arent bi. Aesthectic attraction is the kind of attraction where you appreciate somethings (or someones) beauty but dont nessesary want to interact. It is sometimes compared with finding a painting in a museum soo beautiful, that you could stare and appreciate it the whole day. Sometimes it is difficult to different between the types of attraction. hope this somewhat helped you. good luck exploring your sexuality and who you are.

Yes, that qualifies as “bi”. But everybody is bisexual to some degree. Indeed, everybody is pansexual to some degree. It’s just a matter of the proportions in the mix. One may be 79 percent straight and 19 percent homosexual, with the remaining 2 percent being you attracted to, say, animals. Entirely possible!
